column4: So does anybody know if Ubuntu has something similar to the 'world' file in Gentoo, like a list of all the packages I explicitly installed and not just their dependancies?  Like, a list that would contain abiword, but not libgtk or abiword-common?
that doesn't work, I need a list of everything
you can provide an empty glob.   dpkg -l
well, not everything, just the things I have asked to install.  Not their dependancies
and I don't care about libwhatever-3.9 when a package I actually care about needs it
i'm sure there is a way, i just don't remember it
I think the 'deborphan' command may be what I need here actually... I found it while googling around with some of the commands you gave me. :o
are you wanting to remove all packages you didn't install manually/explicitly .. or just list them?
I'm more looking for a list of everything I've installed explicitly, not to remove anything
so that whenever I have to reinstall ubuntu I can also reinstall that entire list in one command
then i dont think deborpan is the right tool
but ""deborphan -a"" lists every package that doesn't have something else depending on it, which is close enough to what I want
the way i see it -- if you create a diff between the packages installed on your setup now and that off a fresh install, you get the list of packages that need installing, does that not make sense?
